Developing Scripts¶

Script Framework¶

Tests are a collection of scripts to test the functionality of a device-under-test (DUT). They can be used as unit/regression tests for Models under development, or they can automate functional testing of a physical device.

Programmatically, tests are Python objects that inherit the Test Base class contained in tests.t_Base.t_Base. Any class that inherits the Test Base class will launch a Tkinter dialog when instantiated. From this dialog, individual test functions can be run

class labtronyx.Base_Script.Base_Script[source]¶

Base object for tests

Tests are a collection of scripts to test the functionality of a device-under-test (DUT). They are not necessarily limited to regression testing for software, but can also be used to test physical devices.

class g_ConsoleLoggerHandler(console)[source]¶

Logging handler to direct logging input to a Tkinter Text widget

Base_Script.registerTest(name, method_name)[source]¶

Notify the test framework to register a test function.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Human readable test name
  • method_name (str) – Method name
Base_Script.requireInstrument(name, attr_name, **kwargs)[source]¶

Notify the test framework to require an Instrument. Instrument will be registered as an attribute during test startup. At least one of the optional arguments must be provided to correctly identify an instrument.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Human readable instrument name
  • attr_name (str) – Attribute to register
  • serial (str) – Optional - Serial number to identify instrument
  • model (str) – Optional - Model number to identify instrument
  • type (str) – Optional - Instrument type to identify instrument
  • driver (str) – Optional - Instrument driver (Model) to identify instrument)
